pages.title: MCP Get
pages.description: Implemented according to the Streamable HTTP Transport specification.

pages.title: MCP Post
pages.description: Sends a JSON-RPC 2.0 message to the server.

pages.title: Terminate Session
pages.description: Terminate an MCP session. The server implementation is stateless, so this is a no-op.

pages.title: Create Background Run
pages.description: Create a run and return the run ID immediately. Don't wait for the final run output.

pages.title: Create Run Batch
pages.description: Create a batch of runs and return immediately.

pages.title: Create Run, Stream Output
pages.description: Create a run and stream the output.

pages.title: Create Run, Wait for Output
pages.description: Create a run, wait for the final output and then return it.

pages.title: List namespaces with optional match conditions.
Search for items within a namespace prefix.
Health Check
pages.description: Check the health status of the server. Optionally check database connectivity.

pages.title: Server Information
pages.description: Get server version information, feature flags, and metadata.

pages.title: System Metrics
pages.description: Get system metrics in Prometheus or JSON format for monitoring and observability.

pages.title: Cancel Runs
pages.description: Cancel one or more runs. Can cancel runs by thread ID and run IDs, or by status filter.

pages.title: Create Background Run
pages.description: Create a run in existing thread, return the run ID immediately. Don't wait for the final run output.

pages.title: Create Run, Stream Output
pages.description: Create a run in existing thread. Stream the output.

pages.title: Create Run, Wait for Output
pages.description: Create a run in existing thread. Wait for the final output and then return it.

pages.title: Delete Run
pages.description: Delete a run by ID.

pages.title: Get Run
pages.description: Get a run by ID.

pages.title: Join Run
pages.description: Wait for a run to finish.

pages.title: Join Run Stream
pages.description: Join a run stream. This endpoint streams output in real-time from a run similar to the /threads/__THREAD_ID__/runs/stream endpoint. If the run has been created with `stream_resumable=true`, the stream can be resumed from the last seen event ID.

pages.title: List Runs
pages.description: List runs for a thread.

pages.title: Copy Thread
pages.description: Create a new thread with a copy of the state and checkpoints from an existing thread.

pages.title: Count Threads
pages.description: Get the count of threads matching the specified criteria.

pages.title: Create Thread
pages.description: Create a thread.

pages.title: Delete Thread
pages.description: Delete a thread by ID.

pages.title: Get Thread
pages.description: Get a thread by ID.

pages.title: Get Thread History
pages.description: Get all past states for a thread.

pages.title: Get Thread History Post
pages.description: Get all past states for a thread.

pages.title: Get Thread State
pages.description: Get state for a thread.

pages.title: Get Thread State At Checkpoint
pages.description: Get state for a thread at a specific checkpoint.

pages.title: Get Thread State At Checkpoint
pages.description: Get state for a thread at a specific checkpoint.

pages.title: Join Thread Stream
pages.description: This endpoint streams output in real-time from a thread. The stream will include the output of each run executed sequentially on the thread and will remain open indefinitely. It is the responsibility of the calling client to close the connection.

pages.title: Patch Thread
pages.description: Update a thread.

pages.title: Prune Threads
pages.description: Prune threads by ID. The 'delete' strategy removes threads entirely. The 'keep_latest' strategy prunes old checkpoints but keeps threads and their latest state (requires FF_USE_CORE_API=true).

pages.title: Search Threads
pages.description: Search for threads.

pages.title: Update Thread State
pages.description: Add state to a thread.

pages.title: Distributed tracing with Agent Server
pages.description: Unify traces when calling your deployed Agent Server from another service using RemoteGraph or the SDK.
